intro: Prenanthes subdentata, commonly known as the smooth false watercress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many familiar edible plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, heart-shaped leaves that are smooth and not toothed. Its flowers are typically white or pale green and arranged in umbels, which are clusters of flowers radiating from a single point. Prenanthes subdentata is often found in moist habitats such as stream banks and wet meadows.
